titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Adelaide Mudgley letter of resignation 1978.096
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2013-08-08T16:18-0400

did.abstract: Letter from Adelaide Mudgley to Mr. L.E. Nicot, resigning from her position as a teacher at Brooklyn's Public School No. 19 in order to get married. Dated 1883. Adelaide Mudgley was a first grade teacher for girls at Public School No. 19 in Brooklyn. At the time of her resignation in 1883, she resided at 256 South Fourth Street.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1977.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Adelaide Mudgley letter of resignation, 1978.096, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Adelaide Mudgley was a first grade teacher for girls at Public School No. 19 in Brooklyn. At the time of her resignation in 1883, she resided at 256 South Fourth Street.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letter from Adelaide Mudgley to Mr. L.E. Nicot, resigning from her position as a teacher at Brooklyn's Public School No. 19 in order to get married. Dated 1883.
